sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you grind <radical>rice</radical>, every <radical>part</radical> of it, eventually it will become a fine <kanji>powder</kanji>. You can then use this rice powder as a part to create some other dish. Some kind of cake, perhaps.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself grinding this rice into a powder. Hear the scrape of the rice on stone as you grind it down to the finest powder.
readingMnemonic: Actually, grinding the rice down to a <kanji>powder</kanji> is super <reading>fun</reading> (<ja>ふん</ja>). It’s so fun you don’t want to stop! AH HAHAHAHA! RICE POWDER! SO FUN!
readingInfo: Okay, we got a little carried away there. Just keep in mind how fun this is. Make sure you say fun with a little bit of a Scottish accent. You know what they say, Scots have more fun!
